title: Trees for the wheatlands
creator_contributor_role: Western Australian Government Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Agriculture - Environmental aspects

description: The importance of trees for shade and shelter, beautification, and control of wind erosion in certain areas of the wheatbelt. The Forests Department of Western Australia renders valuable service to farmers and others who desire to plant trees on their properties.
